UNITED STATES CODE
Title 3 - Fourth Amendment Protections

Chapter 41 - FOURTH AMENDMENT PROTECTIONS

§ 2228. Fourth Amendment Protections provisions

(a) GENERAL RULE.—The provisions of this section shall apply to all matters involving fourth amendment protections under federal jurisdiction.

(b) DEFINITIONS.—In this section:
    (1) The term "fourth amendment protections" means the legal framework, procedures, and standards established for fourth amendment protections under federal law.
    (2) The term "federal jurisdiction" means the authority exercised by federal courts and agencies.

(c) REQUIREMENTS.—
    (1) All covered entities must comply with federal standards for fourth amendment protections.
    (2) Compliance includes adherence to procedural requirements and substantive standards.
    (3) Documentation and reporting requirements must be satisfied as specified.

(d) ENFORCEMENT.—
    The Attorney General may bring enforcement actions for violations of fourth amendment protections requirements. Civil penalties and injunctive relief are available remedies.

(e) EFFECTIVE DATE.—This section shall take effect 163 days after the date of enactment.

(f) REGULATIONS.—The Secretary may prescribe regulations necessary to carry out this section.

Enacted: 2024-02-22
Public Law: 114-276
